title: Beyond The Good Place's Initial Moral Assumptionism (No Spoilers)
description:
The Good Place began with Michael Schur's wanting there to be a consequence for certain driver's bad behavior in LA traffic. Why might we want there to be an afterlife that is not just pleasant but also consequential? Americans often believe that "spirituality" is self-evident but the diversity of ideas alone reveals this to be a naive idea. Most Americans imagine that morality not only involves a sense of universal or objective morality but also relational morality. There is also the complexity of personality traits in morality. We take an initial look at just how complex morality really is beyond the naive assumptions we often begin with. 

Michael Schur on the Ezra Klein Show https://www.vox.com/podcasts/2019/12/10/21002589/the-good-place-mike-shur-moral-philosophy-the-ezra-klein-show
My Name is Earl https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Name_Is_Earl
The Good Place Afterlife Point System https://youtu.be/hY-Rzou38k4
The Good Place Doug Forcett https://youtu.be/HPEwD7WpI9g
Jordan Peterson Trait Agreeableness https://youtu.be/G1eHJ9DdoEA
Soul Search, The Spiritual Assumptions of American Youth https://amzn.to/39h7uXm
Hitler's Religion https://amzn.to/2S5rKFO
The Good Place Judge https://youtu.be/4gw9Clr9kfc
Eleanor Shellstrop's mother https://youtu.be/Z0lsNJ1t_3A
Timothy Keller Preaching https://amzn.to/2SaAY3H
Tom Holland Persian Fire https://amzn.to/31xG1Os
CS Lewis Mere Christianity https://amzn.to/38eep3K
CS Lewis the Abolition of Man https://amzn.to/3bjiXrl
